DataElement.preferredDefinition: The method by which the file checksum was calculated.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A data file stored as an electronic record.:A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A data file stored as an electronic record.

Concepts.definition: A data file stored as an electronic record.

Property.preferredDefinition: A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. (http://foldoc.doc.ic.ac.uk/foldoc/foldoc.cgi?checksum)

Concepts.definition: A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A 32-character hexadecimal number that is computed on a file.

Concepts.definition: A 32-character hexadecimal number that is computed on a file.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An algorithm for computing a condensed representation of a message or a data file that produces a 160-bit message digest.

Concepts.definition: An algorithm for computing a condensed representation of a message or a data file that produces a 160-bit message digest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An algorithm for computing a condensed representation of a message or a data file that produces a 256-bit message digest.

Concepts.definition: An algorithm for computing a condensed representation of a message or a data file that produces a 256-bit message digest.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.
